Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery bowl; animal frieze bordered above by maeander band between bands of red lined in white; part of two goats to left with rosette filling ornament; inside streaky black with red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 5-6, N 16) (Labelled T.2974)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 47, no. 2)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (p. 1 II D, no. 4, pl. 2, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.396)
